Class Site

  • java.lang.Object
    • Site

  • public class Site
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    scottfloam and pratikkarnik

    Site

    The Site class consists of a DataTable that holds Variable(s) and a LockTable corresponding with those Variable(s). See DataTable and LockTable for more information about these respective classes.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString: gets information about the Site
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the Site's ID and its Variable(s) with their respective values

      • fail

        public void fail()
        fail: simulates the failure of a Site. When failure occurs, this method sets the Site's isUp flag to false to indicate that the Site is down. It also removes all LockObj from the LockTable. Furthermore, it sets previouslyFailed to true to indicate that the Site failed at some point during the run of the program. The site also replaces the intermediate value which may have been a pending write value, with the last committed value.

      • recover

        public void recover()
        recover: simulates the recovery of a Site. When recovery occurs, this method will mark the Site as active and mark whether a Variable can be read post recovery.

      • getLT

        public LockTable getLT()
        getLT: gets the LockTable associated with this Site

        hasVariable: determines if this Site has a particular Variable
        Returns:
        true if a Variable is present, false if not.

        public boolean isUp()
        isUp determines if the Site is active

      • getRODataTable

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getRODataTable(java.lang.String txnID)
        getRODataTable a table to preserve the values of Variable(s) when a ROTransaction begins. This table only contains committed values.
        Parameters:
        txnID - -ID of a Transaction
        Returns:

      • isPreviouslyFailed

        public boolean isPreviouslyFailed()
        isPreviouslyFailed determines if the Site failed at some point in the program.
        Returns:
        true if the Site failed at some point in the program, otherwise false
